ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course for a student more interested in chemical biology or biophysics, but not an organic student.
Lots of reading papers and discussing them in class.

The class has few "lectures" of the professor in front of the class and most of the class time is spent discussing papers involving enzymology. I would recommend this course to anyone in biophysical chemistry or biological chemistry because I found it to be very informative.
It was a good class for learning about some aspects of enzyme catalysis, although the final exam was slightly overwhelming.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The kinetics aspects and some of the papers in the first half of the semester were very helpful; however towards the end of the course, the focus seemed to be lots of biophyical methods I will probably never use.
This coursegave me a much better understanding of enzymology.
This course greatly contributed to my field of research, since I anticipate studying enzyme catalysis quite heavily.
